Child.origin: [assault on a under 16 years of age]

1.definition: a son or daughter of any age and usually including one formally adopted compare
1.note: The wordchildas used in a statute or will is often held to include a stepchild, an illegitimate child, a person for whom one stands in loco parentis, or sometimes a more remote descendant, such as a grandchild. In interpreting the wordchildas used in a will, the court will try to effectuate the intent of the person who made the will as it can be determined from the language of the will.

2.definition: a person below an age specified by law[assault on a under 16 years of age] compare
2.note: A person who is below the statutory age but is married will usually be considered an adult.
